intro: Telis monspeliaca, commonly known as the Mediterranean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Telis monspeliaca is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
